alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, northwestern Knox, west central Leslie, northeastern Pulaski, southern Jackson, southern Rockcastle, north central Whitley and Clay Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Malcomb to near Bloss. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Treadway, Fall Rock, Laurel Creek, Burning Springs, Sacker Gap, Chestnutburg, Sidell, Malcomb, Sextons Creek and Grace around 705 PM EDT. Bernice, Mill Pond, Tanksley, Wild Cat, Urban and Hooker around 710 PM EDT. Manchester, Littleton, Horse Creek Junction, Hima, Sibert, Herron and Pigeonroost around 715 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bluehole, Bernstadt, House, Park Valley, Hector, Boho, Goose Rock, Rockcastle Springs, Hightop, Plank, Keavy, Botto, Vox, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Lipps, Creekville, Spring Creek and Baldrock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Whitley
